publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: The defence of Constantine : vvith a treatise of the Popes temporall monarchie. Wherein, besides diuers passages, touching other counsels, both generall and prouinciall, the second Roman Synod, vnder Siluester, is declared to be a meere fiction and forgery. By Richard Crakanthorp, Doctor of Diuinity
monogr.author: Crakanthorpe, Richard

div.head: Parte 1. in Textu.
div.p:
Page 16. line 15. Artes reade Arles. page 64. line 1 doth represent, reade, doth scarce represent. p. 65. lin. 14. 600. r. 1600. p. 78. lin. 29. much bewrayes. r. much more bewrayes. p. 209. l. 29. Constantius.
• . Constans. p. •• 0. l. 22. dele as, p. 260. l 1. would. r. as they would. p. 262. l. 21. q. 9. r. q. 1. p. 3 21. l. 14. Constantine. r. Iustinian. p. 326. l. 3. r. hauing. l. eadem dele totam. p. 348. l. 29. r. to vntruthes. p. 349▪ l. 28. portes r. parts. p. 25 • . l. 22. Card. r. Corol.
